How Often? - prior to start of season
Records Required - Copy of QA pack and acceptance from Waka Kotahi
How Often? - prior to start of season
Records Required - Copy of final approved program; TAC, SAC and SCRIM
Ensure accuracy of tracker with final program
Method/Test Required - Crosscheck tracker with program
How Often? - prior to start of season
Pre commencement meeting with asphalt delivery team
How Often? - prior to start season
JSEA submitted and communicated to team
How Often? - prior to start season, updates when required or site specific additions; To be signed on by every person working on the site
Records Required - Copy of JSEA signed by AC delivery team
Approved JMF for Strengthening Repairs Mix
Method/Test Required - Confirm validity JMF and conformance with Design report
Records Required - Copy of Approved JMF
Production testing for strenghthening repair mix

Method/Test Required - Binder grading testing Volumetric testing
How Often? - 1 test per 200T of Mix produced 1 test per 600T of mix produced

Method/Test Required - Confirm validity JMF and conformance with Design report
Records Required - Copy of Approved JMF

Method/Test Required - Binder grading testing Volumetric testing
How Often? - 1 test per 200T of Mix produced 1 test per 600T of mix produced

Confirm or establish , NDM offset and rolling patterns
Method/Test Required - Lay down trial or establish a rolling pattern on site
Records Required - Lay down trial report or plateau testing
Responsibility - Renewals manager/Paving manager/ Project engineer
Reference or Specification - Winter Surfacing Site Note
Records Required - Copy of Waka Kotahi Approval
Reference or Specification - NZTA M10: 2020 Notes - Table 3.3
Method/Test Required - As per Table N4.1: NZTA M/10: 2014
Reference or Specification - Site design Report
How Often? - Each site prior to establishment
Records Required - Copy of Approved Design Report
– Confirm RP's and markouts align with design report
– Establish methodology and amount of shifts
– Confirm any service cover adjustment requirements
– Identify potential milling dumpsites and plant parking area's
Reference or Specification - Preseal inspection checksheet
How Often? - Each site prior to establishment
Records Required - Copy of pre seal inspection
Records Required - Copy of stakeholder notification / Photographs of VMS Boards
Daily work briefing, confirm scope, that you have all staff, materials and plant needed to complete the work and weather forecast is compliant; confirm type of plant to be used
Method/Test Required - Brief all team members on day’s work plan
Records Required - Job brief, updated forward works program and screenshot of weather forecast
Method/Test Required - Confirm Approved TMP in place
Ambient Conditions: Min Pavement Surface Temp 5ºC (Intermediate or structural layers) and 10ºC (wearing course) and forecast to be rising/stay above
Records Required - Ground temp record sheet in QA pack
Job start, identify risks and controls, communicated to team
Method/Test Required - Record all risks and controls on Hazard ID following Team discussion
Records Required - Daily pre start briefing Form D02.05
Method/Test Required - Site audit post set up
Identification of Services: Service Plans on-site, Shallow Services marked
Reference or Specification - JSEA/Permit to dig
Method/Test Required - Confirm document on-site / Visual check
Records Required - Permit to dig/ service plans

Milling undertaken to correct depth: up to +10mm nominal thickness for each layer, however If applicable final surface can not end up more than 5mm above lip of channel unless specified otherwise in the Design Report
Reference or Specification - site design Report; NZTA M10: 2020 10.1
Records Required - Stringline sheet from QA pack
Responsibility - Site Supervisor / Site QA/site engineer

Proofrolling to be done on milled surface: Use PTR or loaded Asphalt truck, to proofrol milled area's. Area's showing movement or loose materials shall received additional strenghtening at the specified depth in design report, for up to a maximum cost of 10% from the total site cost.
Reference or Specification - Site design report
Method/Test Required - Proofrolling with PTR or loaded truck
Records Required - Pictures or video, if additional strengthening required a site diagram showing measurements, RP's and location within site
○ Any additional strengthening required over the allowance of 10% for the total cost needs to have received written approval of Renewals manager or NOC Contract manager
Application as per Design Requirements (Chip size / binder application rate)
Delivery and compaction temperature: ±30 degrees from the recommended mixing temperature of 155-170°C To be recorded when mix is tipped into the paver.
Manager to be notified if temperature falls below:
Reference or Specification - NZTA M10: 2020 Notes; Higgins asphalt bitumen guide, NZTA M1A 2019
Records Required - Temperature record sheet; contains delivery temperature, temp when in paver, temp inside the screed and rolling temp
Structural Asphalt Layer Thickness: Each Layer >80mm with a max discrepency of +10mm nominal thickness
Reference or Specification - NZTA M10 2020 10.1 & Table 3.1
Method/Test Required - Dip checks and spreadrates
Records Required - Layer sheet and site diagram in QA pack and photographic evidence for dipchecks
Responsibility - Site Supervisor / Site QA /Site engineer
Reference or Specification - QMP and NDM SOP
Method/Test Required - NDM for Quality Control
How Often? - Minimum of 1 test per 20 lineair meter per run and minimum 1 every 100m on joints
Records Required - NDM sheet in QA pack
Responsibility - Site Supervisor / Site QA / Site Engineer
○ NDM (only where accepted by the Engineer in writing along with the testing plan.)
How Often? - when a lot ≥ 30T; Mat Cores: Cores to be randomly located using ASTM D5361 in each sublot. 1 core per 300m2 sublot and a min 8 cores each lot
○ Joint Cores: Cores to be randomly located using ASTM D5361 in every 100m of joint.
○ NDM (only where accepted by then Engineer as per agreed testing plan.)
Records Required - Photograph of each core; random coring sheet from QA pack and IANZ accredited lab report
○ A lot is deemed acceptable when the Characteristic values of the mat come back within the range of +3,-2 and from the joints +5,-2 from the design airvoids listed on the applicable JMF
Responsibility - Site Supervisor / Site QA/ Site engineer
Delivery and compaction temperature: ±30 degrees from the recommended mixing temperature of 150-175°C To be recorded when mix is tipped into the paver.
Manager to be notified if temperature falls below:
Reference or Specification - NZTA M10: 2020 Notes; Higgins asphalt bitumen guide, NZTA M1A 2019
Records Required - Temperature record sheet; contains delivery temperature, temp when in paver, temp inside the screed and rolling temp

Surface layer thickness: Each Layer >min. layer thickness with a max discrepency of +10mm nominal thickness. If applicable all mix is not more than 5mm above lip of channel unless specified otherwise in the Design Report.
Reference or Specification - NZTA M10:2020 10.1 & NZTA M10:2020 Notes Table 3.3 & 3.4
○ NZTA M27:2020 10.2 & NZTA M27:2020 Notes Table 3.1
Method/Test Required - Dip checks and spreadrates
Records Required - Layer sheet and site diagram in QA pack and photographic evidence for dipchecks
Responsibility - Site Supervisor / Site QA /Site engineer
Reference or Specification - QMP and NDM SOP
Method/Test Required - NDM for Quality Control
How Often? - Minimum of 1 test per 20 lineair meter per run and minimum 1 every 100m on joints
Records Required - NDM sheet in QA pack
Responsibility - Site Supervisor / Site QA / Site Engineer
Reference or Specification - NZTA M10: 2020 9.9 or NZTA M27: 2020 9.9
○ NDM (only where accepted by the Engineer in writing along with the testing plan.)
How Often? - when a lot ≥ 30T; Mat Cores: Cores to be randomly located using ASTM D5361 in each sublot. 1 core per 300m2 sublot and a min 8 cores each lot
○ Joint Cores: Cores to be randomly located using ASTM D5361 in every 100m of joint.
○ NDM (only where accepted by then Engineer as per agreed testing plan.)
Records Required - Photograph of each core; random coring sheet from QA pack and IANZ accredited lab report.
○ A lot is deemed acceptable when the Characteristic values of the mat come back within the range of +3,-2 and from the joints +5,-2 from the design airvoids listed on the applicable JMF
Responsibility - Site Supervisor / Site QA/ Site engineer
Supervisor to provide an update regarding site completion per shift
Linemarking and RRPM Reinstated: Matches previous linemarking - within 48 hours of sealing
Records Required - Job Sheet record & photograph
– Linemarking correctly reinstated, including cat's eyes?
– Site; stockpile and parking area left in tidy condition
– Required service cover adjustments completed; covers to be flush to +10mm with surface
Reference or Specification - Post seal inspection checksheet
How Often? - Each site within 1 week of completion
Records Required - Copy of post seal inspection
Reference or Specification - Site design report
Method/Test Required - Record as-built patch dimensions & RPs
Records Required - Final site diagram from QA pack
Reference or Specification - Comply with Waka Kotahi format
Records Required - Job Sheet record + As-Builts + photographs
